de.hsrm.diogenes.remotepresentation
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      de.hsrm.diogenes.remotepresentation.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Server
extends java.lang.Thread

A Server-Object will be connected to a Client-Object via a network. It's use is to display information of Packets sent by the Client-Object. This class will start connecting using the run-method, which also runs this Object in an own Thread.

Constructor Detail

Server

public Server(int port,
              ExceptionListener el)
Instantiates the Server at the port. The ExceptionListener should be owned by a class holding a Server-Object and given to the Server. This way the class holding the Server (e.g. the GUI) can get Exceptions thrown by the Server. Casual java-Exceptions won't work as this Server runs in an own Thread. The ExceptionListener will be used as a lock for synchronization as well.

Parameters:
port - The port to be opened
el - An ExceptionListener of the class holding this Object (e.g. a GUI)
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Runs the Server in an own Thread and starts accepting Clients (infinite). Notifies any Exceptions to the ExceptionListener after doing so and opens the lock with doing that.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

getPacket

public Presentable getPacket()
Returns a packet containing an image and a text to be displayed by a GUI. Will be updated by a remote Client.

Returns:
The packet containing an image and a text for visualization
